title: Festivals of Mithila
content: Mithila region is known for its vibrant and colorful festivals that reflect its rich cultural heritage.
These festivals are not just religious celebrations but also social gatherings that strengthen community bonds.
Many of these festivals are unique to the Mithila region and showcase its distinct traditions and customs.

festivals.name: Chhath Puja
festivals.description: A festival dedicated to the Sun God, celebrated on the banks of rivers and ponds.

festivals.name: Sama-Chakeva
festivals.description: A festival celebrating the bond between brothers and sisters, unique to the Mithila region.

festivals.name: Jur Sital
festivals.description: A summer festival where people worship the Banyan tree and pray for good harvests.

festivals.name: Madhushravani
festivals.description: A 13-day festival observed by newly married women, involving fasting and storytelling.

festivals.name: Jitiya
festivals.description: A festival observed by women for the well-being of their children and family, involving fasting and rituals.

festivals.name: Bihula
festivals.description: A festival celebrating the story of Bihula and her dedication to her husband, with rituals and traditional songs.
